usefulItems: pancake pan or frying pan, small ladle, cling film, oven-proof dish for serving, hob, oven
title: Pancakes with Spinach, Bacon and Ricotta

ingredients.content: 120 g bacon, cured and smoked, sliced
300 g fresh spinach leaves, roughly chopped

preparations.content: Place buckwheat flour, plain flour, eggs, milk, water and oil in mixing bowl then mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside to rest for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and continue with recipe.
Place bacon in mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic, onions and oil in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Cook <b>10 min/120°C/speed 1<b>.
Add reserved chopped bacon and cook <b>5 min/120°C/speed 1<b>.
Add spinach, salt and pepper then cook <b>15 min/120°C//speed 1<b>.
Drain cooked spinach mixture through simmering basket, squeezing out well and discarding liquid, then transfer to a bowl.
Place bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in ricotta, cream and pine nuts. Mix well then set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Once batter has rested, heat a knob of butter in a large pancake or frying pan over a medium heat. Pour a small ladle of batter into the centre then spread out thinly. Cook for 2-3 minutes, then flip over and cook for a further minute, then transfer to a plate, cover and keep warm. Repeat, adding more butter when necessary, until all batter is used, then preheat oven to 180°C.
Drain cooked spinach mixture through simmering basket, squeezing out well and discarding the liquid.
Arrange pancakes on a work surface and distribute filling evenly between each. Roll pancakes up and place in an oven-proof dish.
Place cheese in mixing bowl and grate <b>7 sec/speed 10<b>.
Add cream and heat <b>5 min/100°C/speed 1<b> to thicken sauce. Pour sauce over pancakes.
Bake for 10 minutes (180°C) then serve immediately while still hot.
